Cathal Breathnach

Medical Student, NUI Galway. Electronic & Computer Engineer.

Twitter LinkedIn Github Email

Hi, I'm Cathal.

I’m a current Medical Student at NUI Galway. Previously, I completed a degree in Electronic & Computer Engineering and worked mainly in data and machine learning engineering. I intend to pursue a career in clinical medicine but I’ve always had a fascination with technology and am interested to see how my engineering background will of use as new innovations in emerging technologies continue to innovate in the clinical setting.


This is my personal website, and includes some information on the experience and skills I have in the CV section. I’ve also included some detail on a few of the projects I’ve worked on. I previously worked as an intern in Aerogen, and later in Genesys working on their Data Science Team, as a member of the Artifiical Intelligence Group. For the summer months of 2020, I’m back working in Electronics R&D at Aerogen. You can download a PDF copy of my CV by clicking here.


Some more information is available on my LinkedIn page or you can also take at look at some of my work contained in my Github repositories.


I enjoy spending my spare time in the outdoors and time spent mountaineering and Scouting has brought me all over the world on a wide variety of adventures. I value the amount you can learn from visiting a new place and by putting yourself outside your comfort zone. I also enjoy running, swimming and cycling, sometimes play the piano and read quite a few books.


If you would like to get in contact, please feel free to send me an email to breathnach.cathal@gmail.com at any time.
